title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring

Save the Cat.Opening Image: The Shire is lush, peaceful, and insulated from the wider world — an idyllic home symbolizing innocence and simplicity.
Save the Cat.Theme Stated: Galadriel’s voiceover and later Gandalf’s words to Frodo suggest that courage can be found in unexpected places — that even the smallest person can shape the fate of the world.
Save the Cat.Set-Up: Frodo inherits the One Ring after Bilbo departs. Gandalf begins to suspect its true nature. The Shire’s calm is juxtaposed with an encroaching darkness.
Save the Cat.Catalyst: Gandalf confirms that the ring is the One Ring and sends Frodo away before the Nazgûl arrive — the true scope of the danger is revealed.
Save the Cat.Debate: Frodo is frightened and uncertain. He questions why he was chosen and whether he can endure such a responsibility.
Save the Cat.Break into Two: Frodo leaves the Shire with Sam, beginning a journey that will reshape him and the world. The story expands from pastoral to epic.
Save the Cat.B Story: The relationships within the Fellowship form the emotional core — trust, loyalty, sacrifice, and temptation weave through these bonds.
Save the Cat.Fun and Games: The company traverses Middle-earth, facing trolls, mines, and moral tests. We get thrilling action, character development, and the grandeur of Tolkien’s world.
Save the Cat.Midpoint: The Fellowship officially forms in Rivendell. With purpose and unity, they set off, though cracks soon appear — especially through Boromir’s internal struggle.
Save the Cat.Bad Guys Close In: Saruman’s betrayal, the snowbound pass, Moria’s terrors, and the pull of the Ring wear down the group. The Ring’s power isolates Frodo.
Save the Cat.All Is Lost: Gandalf falls in Moria. The group's leader is gone. Grief and fear threaten to unravel the quest.
Save the Cat.Dark Night of the Soul: Boromir tries to take the Ring. Frodo realizes he endangers his friends. The burden is his alone to carry.
Save the Cat.Break into Three: Frodo decides to go to Mordor alone. Sam’s loyalty drives him to follow, underscoring the film’s heart.
Save the Cat.Finale: The Fellowship breaks. Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli pursue Merry and Pippin. Frodo and Sam press onward, aware that this journey will test them to their limits.
Save the Cat.Final Image: Frodo and Sam walk into the wild, no longer protected or naive. The world darkens, but they move forward with quiet determination.

Hero’s Journey.Ordinary World: Frodo lives a gentle life in the Shire, surrounded by laughter, gardens, and books — untouched by evil.
Hero’s Journey.Call to Adventure: Gandalf reveals that the Ring is a threat to all life and urges Frodo to flee.
Hero’s Journey.Trials: Frodo faces Black Riders, internal fears, and interpersonal conflicts on the road to Rivendell and beyond.
Hero’s Journey.Ordeal: In the face of betrayal and danger, Frodo sees the toll the Ring takes. He resolves to break from the group and go alone — the ultimate test of will.
Hero’s Journey.Return: Joined by Sam, Frodo continues the journey into Mordor, transformed by loss, responsibility, and the first leg of his heroic transformation.

Story Circle.You: Frodo is an ordinary hobbit — cautious, kind, and unaware of the scale of evil in the world.
Story Circle.Need: He must rise to an impossible challenge and learn to carry unbearable weight without losing himself.
Story Circle.Go: Leaving the Shire, he ventures into a world of danger, magic, and moral peril.
Story Circle.Find: Frodo faces death, betrayal, and the lure of power. He sees how the Ring corrupts even the noble.
Story Circle.Return: He leaves the Fellowship behind, stepping into darkness with Sam — not yet victorious, but firmly on the hero’s path.
